articles.title: CONMEBOL World Cup qualifying: Colombia collapse continues in loss to Argentina; Peru, Uruguay in great shape
articles.description: Things have really taken shape in South America as the end of qualification nears
articles.content: Just two matches remain for every team in CONMEBOL as the January-February World Cup qualifying window in South America closed on Tuesday, and the table has painted a clear picture as to who will likely be in Qatar and who won't. While Brazil and Arg... [3381 chars]

articles.title: Brazil beat Paraguay; Argentina edge Colombia, Rodrigo Bentancur and Alexis Sanchez inspire Uruguay and Chile in World Cup qualifying
articles.description: Raphinha and Philippe Coutinho on target as Brazil end Paraguays Qatar 2022 hopes; Argentina dent Colombias qualification chances; Spurs signing Rodrigo Bentancur and Alexis Sanchez score to boost Uruguay and Chile, while Ecuador on brink of reaching World Cup
articles.content:
Brazil scored twice in the last four minutes to cap a comfortable 4-0 win over Paraguay in Tuesday's World Cup qualifier in Belo Horizonte.

articles.title: FIFA World Cup Qualifiers: Brazil Cruise Past Paraguay, Argentina Trump Colombia
articles.description: FIFA 2022 World Cup qualifiers: Brazil registered an easy 4-0 win over Paraguay while Colombia attained a 7-game goalless streak after their 1-0 loss to Argentina.
articles.content: Brazil ended Paraguay hopes to making it to FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 with a 4-0 win in Tuesday’s World Cup qualifier Belo Horizonte. Philippe Coutinho, Raphinha, Antony and Rodrygo were on target in Brazil’s win. Coutinho scored the pick of the goal... [2904 chars]

articles.title: Argentina put Colombia farther from WC spot, Chile survive
articles.description: Colombia's chances of playing in the next World Cup have shrunk after losing 1-0 to Argentina.
articles.content:
Colombia will need a miracle to play in the next World Cup after its 1-0 loss to Argentina in South American qualifying on Tuesday.
Lautaro Martinez scored the only goal of the match in Cordoba in the 29th minute after he was left alone in the penalt... [3157 chars]

articles.title: FIFA World Cup 2022 Qualifiers: Uruguay boost qualification hopes by beating Venezuela, Argentina defeat Colombia
articles.description: Young winger Facundo Pellistri stole the show on only his second appearance for Uruguay.
articles.content:
Young winger Facundo Pellistri stole the show on only his second appearance for Uruguay.
Young winger Facundo Pellistri stole the show on only his second appearance for Uruguay as the twice former World Cup winners boosted their hopes of reaching Qat... [3787 chars]

articles.title: Soccer-Martinez goal gives Argentina 1-0 win over Colombia
articles.description: Brazil and Argentina have already qualified and Ecuador’s 24 points mean they are almost certain to join them. The result leaves Colombia in seventh place in the 10-team table with 17 points, five points behind Uruguay, two behind Chile, and three behind Peru, who could strengthen their position further with a win over Ecuador later on Tuesday.
articles.content: Argentina extended their unbeaten run to 29 games on Tuesday when they beat a toothless Colombia 1-0 in a World Cup qualifier. Lautaro Martinez got the only goal of an untidy game after 29 minutes when he took advantage of slack defending to rifle ho... [1496 chars]

articles.title: Soccer-Chile beat Bolivia to keep World Cup qualification hopes alive
articles.description: Uruguay’s second victory in a row under new coach Diego Alonso takes them on to 22 points and Chile have 19, one less than Peru, who play Ecuador later on Tuesday. Argentina also face Colombia, who start the night on 17 points, while leaders Brazil face Paraguay, who need a win to keep their slim hopes alive.
articles.content:
Uruguay and Chile recorded crucial wins on Tuesday to keep their World Cup qualification hopes alive.
In Bolivia, a double from Alexis Sanchez helped Chile beat Bolivia 3-2, while in Montevideo, Uruguay hammered Venezuela 4-1. The top four teams in t... [1509 chars]

articles.title: Argentina exported $2.4 bln of grains in January - CIARA-CEC
articles.description: Feb 1 (Reuters) - Argentine exports of grain, oilseeds and their derivatives totaled some $2.4 billion in January, the country's CIARA-CEC chamber of oilseed crushers and export companies said on Tuesday, slightly down versus a month earlier.In December, the country registered $2.68 billion in grains exports, with a total $32.8 billion in 2021.The CIARA-CEC chamber said high
